div.p: Dynamics of the Northern Hemisphere atmospheric response to the OWBCs: ( a– c) represent the wintertime response to SST-front of: ( a) the baroclinicity (in 1/day), ( b) storm-tracks and ( c) horizontal components of E-vector (vectors, see Method) superposed on the tropospheric zonal wind at 250 hPa (shaded in m/s) and 950 hPa (white contour, in m/s). ( d) represents the response of the stratospheric EP-flux (vector, see Method) and its feedback on the zonally averaged zonal wind (shaded in (m/s)/day). In all panels, only significant differences at 95%-level according to a two-tailed t-test are shaded.
